a:r.a:t: What are the motives (EMPIRE) behind imperialism?
E – Exploratory – Map new territory and figure out if it is good, as well as find native people and natural resources.
M – Militarism. Countries believed that having a strong military would allow them to get whatever they wanted.
P – Political – Claim land for the “mother country”, make sure the country has resources, and control the country’s government.
I – Ideological – “Improve” the non-European way of life, to make them more like Europeans, and have them adopt a European perspective.
R – Religious – Convert native people to Christianity, and change the beliefs of the next generation of natives.
E – Economic – Get raw materials for goods (for supply), make natives purchase European goods(Demand), and make money.
